intro: Bedfordia linearis var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedfordia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its linear, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
